pageContext.claim: “I was in the White House all by myself for six, seven days. It was very lonely. My family was down in Florida. They were all -- I said, stay there and enjoy yourself. But I felt I should be here just in case people wanted to come and negotiate the border security.”
pageContext.analysis: Trump was not alone in the White House on Christmas Eve, or on Christmas. First lady Melania Trump cut short a trip to Florida to join the president in Washington from Christmas Eve onward. They flew together to visit U.S. troops in Iraq on Dec. 26.
